title: Concerning the runes reforged iterations on PBE
body:
I just wanted to mention to any perusing Rioters that I really like the changes to Dark Harvest, Gaurdian, Arcane Comet, Zombie Ward, Eyeball Collection, Sudden Inpact and so many other runes during their time on PBE.

The changes to Press the Attack I am a bit more iffy on, but precision was always destined to be my least used tree anyway as I despise playing the adc role (though Teemo is fun despite his marksman designation and Quinn was fun post rework until they added the blind back and took all the damage away).

Anyway, thank you for fixing so many things so quickly. It is impressive and preseason looks more exciting every week. I keep annoying my brother and our friends talking about it.

Keep up the great work!
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

replies.body:
> [{quoted}](name=Tenth Leper,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=HLteJWwi,comment-id=,timestamp=2017-10-12T22:49:00.950+0000)
>
>I keep annoying my brother and our friends talking about it.

Glad we've been able to help you with that! ;)

On a more serious note I'm curious as to what's on your mind, particularly about the Press the Attack concerns, but also what about the other changes interests you.
Quick question about the Kleptomancy rune, if I take it on Draven will it trigger his 'Yoink' voice line when it gets an item?  If not, can it please?

Im a bit confused on who would use this version of Press The Attack. It seems more like a supportive rune that, ofc, a support would take. There seems to be no incentive for damage dealers to take it unless youre like Camille or something.

If I were to be designing a damage amp keystone like press the attack (which would be a bad idea because my logic is poor) I would probably make the amp itself slightly larger and significantly easier to apply and then restrict it to either only damage dealt by the champion applying it OR only damage dealt by champions other than the one applying it. In either case I would remove the proc damage.

I believe buffs and debuffs are poorly viewed by riot designers generally because of "invisible power" and not being "visceral" but a well done visual effect and/or audio queue would make sure the power was visible and apreciable. The ardent fiasco of recent patches has proven that temporary stat buffs at least can be very noticeable, so I expect a debuff could be made similarly so (if hopefully not quite as required/broken).

The iteration of PtA currently on PBE has its associated questions, imo:

1. It is rather similar to Electrocute, being a 3-hit effect. It has less damage, sure, but also the general damage amplification that affects all sources of damage afterwards. Also, it lacks an on-target cooldown, meaning that the damage will just keep coming.
2. Unlike the previous iteration, it lends itself to a more bursty damage pattern - spiking on every third hit instead of getting an increase in DPS every hit.
3. I take it that it works somewhat like Vayne's W, where attacking a different target resets the counter?
4. It feels rather generic, being a 3-hit effect (another of these, really?) and a simple damage amplification.
5. The second effect being a generic damage amplification makes it hit squishies rather hard. Coupled with its bursty nature, it looks quite attractive on assassins. Would there be an argument for the second effect being adaptive penetration instead of a general damage amp?
